text.p: Shares in media and leisure group Lusomundo-SGPS jumped 6.69 percent on Wednesday to 1,340 escudos ($8.8) but traders said the stock must soon hit its ceiling.

The share has been rising sharply on the company's improved prospects after it reported a swing back to profit in the first half of 1996. "People are buying because the first half was good," said one trader.
But traders said that it would be difficult for the stock to keep rising in anything like good liquidity as it would be increasingly vulnerable to profit-taking.
"There were purchases closer to 1,000 escudos and these may be interested in taking profit," said a trader.
Lusomundo expects to make a full-year profit of 776 million escudos, after minorities, against a 614 million loss in 1995.
"The forecasts are attainable (and) the stock is not expensive in fundamental terms. But I do not believe that it can climb rapidly from here above 1,350-1,400 escudos," added another trader.
The company hit its high for the year on March 25 when it reached 1,490 escudos per share. The share price fell back on profit-taking in April.
